identificationModule.briefTitle: Role of Aging and Individual Variation in Exercise Training Responsiveness
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Role of Aging and Individual Variation in Exercise Training Responsiveness

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The primary purpose of this study is to assess the effects of aging on markers of physical reserve and exercise-induced adaptations in resilience in older adults who completed a structured exercise program within the last 15 years (Parent trial: STRRIDE-PD; NCT00962962). This feasibility pilot study will enroll up to 8 participants to complete a 6-month aerobic exercise intervention.

armGroups.label: Low Amount/Moderate Intensity (Low/Mod)
armGroups.description: Six months of low amount/moderate intensity aerobic exercise

armGroups.label: High Amount/Moderate Intensity (High/Mod)
armGroups.description: Six months of high amount/moderate intensity aerobic exercise

armGroups.label: High Amount/Vigorous Intensity (High/Vig)
armGroups.description: Six months of high amount/vigorous intensity aerobic exercise

interventions.name: Low/Mod
interventions.description: Aerobic exercise at 50% peak oxygen consumption expending approximately 1000 kilocalories per week equaling approximately 10 miles per week

interventions.name: High/Mod
interventions.description: Aerobic exercise at 50% peak oxygen consumption expending approximately 1600 kilocalories per week equaling approximately 16 miles per week

interventions.name: High/Vig
interventions.description: Aerobic exercise at 75% peak oxygen consumption expending approximately 1600 kilocalories per week equaling approximately 16 miles per week

primaryOutcomes.description: Insulin sensitivity will be measured with a 2-hour oral glucose tolerance test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

primaryOutcomes.description: Cardiorespiratory fitness will be measured with a maximal cardiopulmonary exercise test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported health outcomes (including global physical health) will be captured using the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported health outcomes (including global mental health) will be captured using the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported quality of life outcomes will be captured using the SF-36 Health Survey. The survey is scored into eight domains: physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Continuous metabolic syndrome scores are calculated using differences between Adult Treatment Panel III guideline values and participant values for mean arterial blood pressure, minimal waist circumference, fasting HDL-C, triglycerides, and glucose with normalization to the cohort standard deviations.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Body composition will be assessed as percent fat mass and percent fat-free mass.

The Short Physical Performance Battery will objectively assess lower extremity function related to gait, balance, and strength in older adults. The 6-minute walk test will provide a measure of functional status or fitness.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, early-intervention (~6 weeks), and post-intervention (~24 weeks)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Individuals who completed participation in the STRRIDE-PD trial (NCT00962962)
* Stable dose (â‰¥1 month) of any cardiometabolic medications

Exclusion Criteria:

* Poor vein access
* Current use of tobacco or any nicotine products, including e-cigarettes
* Insulin-dependent diabetes
* Systemic inflammatory or connective tissue disease, chronic infectious disease, chronic pulmonary disease or symptomatic cardiovascular disease with positive functional study by ECG or imaging
* Current, actively treated malignancy
* Presence of cardiac arrhythmias that prohibit safe exercise testing or any other absolute or relative contraindication to exercise based on current guidelines from the American College of Sports Medicine
* Unable to safely participate in an exercise program per study protocol per PI discretion
